react4j

Class Component

  • java.lang.Object
    • react4j.Component

  • public abstract class Component
extends Object
    The base java class that mirrors the react component.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • bindComponent

        protected final void bindComponent(@Nonnull
                                   NativeComponent nativeComponent)
        Bind the native react component to this component. This should not be called by user code and is instead invoked by the generated component class.
        Parameters:
        nativeComponent - the native react component.

      • props

        protected final jsinterop.base.JsPropertyMap<Object> props()
        Return the component props from the native component. This may be null if no props were supplied.
        Returns:
        the component state.

      • scheduleRender

        protected final void scheduleRender()
        Schedule this component for re-rendering skipping the shouldComponentUpdate() lifecycle method. This is equivalent to calling scheduleRender(boolean) passing a true value.
        See Also:
        scheduleRender(boolean)

      • scheduleRender

        protected final void scheduleRender(boolean force)
        Schedule this component for re-rendering. The component re-renders when props change but calling this method is another way to schedule the component to be re-rendered. When this method is called the shouldComponentUpdate() lifecycle method will be skipped if the force parameter is true as calling this method is equivalent to calling forceUpdate() on the native react component. See the React Component documentation for more details.
        Parameters:
        force - if true then the component will skip the shouldComponentUpdate() lifecycle method.

      • render

        @Nullable
protected abstract ReactNode render()
        Render the component. See the React Component documentation for more details.
        Returns:
        the result of rendering.

      • storeDebugDataAsState

        @OmitSymbol(unless="react4j.store_debug_data_as_state")
protected final void storeDebugDataAsState()
        Store debug data on the state object of the native component. This is only done if React.shouldStoreDebugDataAsState() returns true and is primarily done to make it easy to debug the component from within React DevTools.

      • getComponentId

        @ComponentIdRef
protected abstract int getComponentId()
        Return the unique identifier of component according to Arez.
        Returns:
        the unique identifier of component according to Arez.

      • getComponentName

        @ComponentNameRef
protected abstract String getComponentName()
        Return the name of the component according to Arez.
        Returns:
        the name of the component according to Arez.

      • populateDebugData

        @OmitSymbol(unless="react4j.store_debug_data_as_state")
protected void populateDebugData(@Nonnull
                                                                                         jsinterop.base.JsPropertyMap<Object> data)
        Populate the state parameter with any data that is useful when debugging the component.
        Parameters:
        data - the property map to populate with debug data.
